intro: Gleicheniastrum speluncae, commonly known as the cave fern, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to grow in dark, humid environments such as caves. The plant lacks true roots and instead absorbs nutrients through its leaf surfaces, a feature common in epiphytic and lithophytic species. It is found in subterranean habitats where it relies on moisture from dripping water and organic matter. Due to its restricted distribution and specific ecological requirements, Gleicheniastrum speluncae is considered a rare and endangered species.
